issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: ORC writer has its own memory manager that assumes memory usage or memory available based on JVM heap (MemoryMX bean). This works on tez container mode execution model but not in LLAP where container sizes (and Xmx) are typically high and there are multiple executors per LLAP daemon. This custom memory manager should be aware of memory bounds per executor.Â
fields.summary: LLAP aware memory manager for Orc writers

comments.body: [~sershe] can you please review? small patch. This patch needs ORC-409Â (also needs review :))Â for it to work correctly (scaling the stripe size).Â
I guess this would need more changes.. the memory manager has to be local at task level.. i will update the patch..
Made the llap aware memory manager thread local similar to the default memory manager.Â
